page.title: 07Hayle Rugby Club.
page.content: The Rugby Club in Hayle was founded in 1877 by T.Edmund Hockin. In 1946 a new wooden club house was built and then,in 1968,the present club house was built. In the present clubhouse there is a lounge and a much bigger room where nearly everybody goes during or after a match. You have to pay for membership so that you can purchace alcohol. In the rugby season which is from the first Saturday in September to the last Saturday in April, the big room is used for after matches and in the evening but you can also rent it for private functions. The club runs two senior teams and one colts team for boys under 19 years old. Over the years some players have represented cornwall and even a few have represented England.
